<<<code>>>: $CODE

Question: How to validate multiple comma separated email id's in android?: :How can i validate multiple comma(,) separated email id's in android.I'm using below code for single email validation.Please can any one help me.static boolean validEmail(String str_newEmail) {         return str_newEmail.matches("^[_A-Za-z0-9-\\+]+(\\.[_A-Za-z0-9-]+)*@"+ "[A-Za-z0-9-]+(\\.[A-Za-z0-9]+)*(\\.[A-Za-z]{2,})$");        }Thanking in Advance.
Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.
Answer:
response:
Please answer my code questions using the given API following this format: <<<api>>>: $API
<<<code>>>: $CODE
<<<explanation>>>: $EXPLANATION.
Question: How to validate multiple comma separated email id's in android?: :How can i validate multiple comma(,) separated email id's in android.I'm using below code for single email validation.Please can any one help me.static boolean validEmail(String str_newEmail) {         return str_newEmail.matches("^[_A-Za-z0-9-\\+]+(\\.[_A-Za-z0-9-]+)*@"+ "[A-Za-z0-9-]+(\\.[A-Za-z0-9]+)*(\\.[A-Za-z]{2,})$");        }Thanking in Advance.
Please using this api: StringTokenizer.nextToken.
Answer: <<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: 
```java
static boolean validEmail(String str_newEmail) {
    final StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(str_newEmail, ",");
    while (st.hasMoreTokens()) {
        final String token = st.nextToken();
        if (!token.matches("^[_A-Za-z0-9-\\+]+(\\.[_A-Za-z0-9-]+)*@"+ "[A-Za-z0-9-]+(\\.[A-Za-z0-9]+)*(\\.[A-Za-z]{2,})$")) {
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: This code uses the StringTokenizer to split the input string into tokens at each comma. It then checks each token to see if it matches the regular expression for a valid email address. If any token does not match, the function returns false. If all tokens match, the function returns true.

Please note that this code assumes that the input string is a comma-separated list of email addresses. If the input string contains spaces or other characters that are not valid in email addresses, the code may not work correctly.

Also, this code does not handle cases where an email address is followed by a comma without a space. If you need to handle such cases, you will need to add additional code to handle them.
